metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 20 axioms covering modes of existence including real existence, time, possibility, necessity, and qualitative probability
metadata.notation: First-order logic with modal operators, constraint-relative possibility, and likelihood scales

axioms.title: Unprimed-Rexist Equivalence
axioms.english: An unprimed predicate p is true of x if and only if there is an eventuality e that is the eventuality of p being true of x and e really exists.

axioms.title: Temporal Argument Equivalence
axioms.fol: (forall (x t) (iff (exists (e) (and (p' e x)(atTime e t))) (p-t x t)))
axioms.english: A predicate with eventuality and atTime is equivalent to a predicate with explicit temporal argument.

axioms.title: Now Exists
axioms.english: Now exists - there is some instant that is Now.

axioms.title: Now is Unique
axioms.english: Now is unique - if t1 and t2 are both Now, then they are equal.

axioms.title: Rexist as Now
axioms.english: For something to really exist is for it to happen or hold Now.

axioms.title: PosMod Argument Constraint
axioms.english: The second argument of PosMod must be a predicate that labels the modality.

axioms.title: Rexist is Positive Modality
axioms.english: Real existence is a positive modality.

axioms.title: Positive Modality Modus Ponens
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 m) (if (and (PosMod e1 m)(imply e1 e2)) (PosMod e2 m)))
axioms.english: Modus ponens can be applied within positive modalities - if e1 exists in modality m and e1 implies e2, then e2 also exists in modality m.

axioms.title: Possible Argument Constraints
axioms.english: Possibility requires an eventuality and a set of constraint eventualities.

axioms.title: Possibility Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (possible e c) (forall (e1) (if (not' e1 e) (not (imply c e1))))))
axioms.english: An eventuality is possible with respect to constraints if those constraints do not imply any negation of the eventuality.

axioms.title: Possibility is Positive Modality
axioms.english: Possibility is a positive modality.

axioms.title: Necessary Argument Constraints
axioms.english: Necessity requires an eventuality and a set of constraint eventualities.

axioms.title: Necessity Definition
axioms.english: An eventuality is necessary with respect to constraints if and only if the constraints imply it.

axioms.title: Necessity is Positive Modality
axioms.english: Necessity is a positive modality because of the transitivity of implication.

axioms.title: Possibility-Necessity Relationship
axioms.fol: (forall (e c e1) (if (and (possible e c)(not' e1 e)) (not (necessary e1 c))))
axioms.english: If an eventuality is possible, its negation is not necessary.

axioms.title: Impossibility Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (impossible e c) (and (eventuality e)(eventualities c) (not (possible e c)))))
axioms.english: Impossibility is the negation of possibility.

axioms.title: Likelihood Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (d e c) (if (likelihood d e c)(and (eventuality e)(eventualities c))))
axioms.english: Likelihood requires an eventuality and a set of constraint eventualities.

axioms.title: Likelihood Scale Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (likelihoodScale s) (exists (s1 e r d1 d2) (and (forall (d) (iff (member d s1) (exists (e c) (likelihood d e c)))) (lowerLikelihood' r d1 d2) (scaleDefinedBy s s1 r)))))
axioms.english: A likelihood scale is a scale whose elements are likelihoods and whose ordering is the lowerLikelihood relation.

axioms.title: Likely Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (likely e c) (exists (s d s1) (and (likelihood d e c)(likelihoodScale s) (Hi s1 s)(inScale d s1)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality is likely with respect to constraints if its likelihood is on the high end of the likelihood scale.

axioms.title: Likely Negation Constraint
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 c) (if (and (likely e c)(not' e1 e)) (not (likely e1 c))))
axioms.english: If an eventuality is likely, its negation is not likely.

axioms.title: Lower or Equal Likelihood
axioms.fol: (forall (d1 d2) (iff (leqLikelihood d1 d2) (or (lowerLikelihood d1 d2)(equal d1 d2))))
axioms.english: Lower or equal likelihood is either lower likelihood or equal likelihood.

conversion_notes.modal_framework: Comprehensive treatment of modes of existence including real existence, possibility, necessity, and qualitative probability
conversion_notes.constraint_relative_modality: Possibility and necessity defined relative to sets of constraint eventualities
conversion_notes.qualitative_probability: Likelihood as qualitative, partially ordered alternative to numerical probability
conversion_notes.positive_modalities: Systematic treatment of modalities supporting modus ponens inference
conversion_notes.axiom_schemas: Two axiom schemas (20.1, 20.2) for relating unprimed predicates, reified predicates, and temporal arguments
conversion_notes.scale_integration: Likelihood scales integrated with Chapter 12's scale framework
conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Uses not', and', or', likelihood', lowerLikelihood' for modal operations
conversion_notes.cross_references: Integrates with Chapters 5 (eventualities, Rexist), 8 (imply), 12 (scales, Hi, top, bottom), 16 (atTime)
conversion_notes.now_anchoring: Uses Now as temporal anchor relating Rexist to atTime

file_format_notes.axiom_selection: Sample of 19 key axioms representing major concepts - full chapter contains 33 axioms including intermediate definitions and scale operations
file_format_notes.section_coverage: Covers Rexist/atTime relationships, positive modalities, possibility/necessity, and likelihood theory
file_format_notes.complexity_justification: Complex axioms involve multiple nested quantifiers, scale operations, or sophisticated modal definitions
file_format_notes.pattern_focus: Emphasizes definitions, type constraints, and logical relationships characteristic of modal logic foundation
file_format_notes.predicate_summary: Chapter introduces 12 new predicates for modal concepts plus axiom schemas for predicate relationships
